title: Lowest Fertilizer Consumption
description: In 2022, South Sudan had the lowest fertilizer consumption in the world, with only 0.0006 kilograms per hectare of arable land.

title: Lowest Access to Electricity
description: As of 2023, only 5.4% of the population in South Sudan had access to electricity, the lowest rate globally.

title: Highest Population Living in Slums
description: In 2016, 94.2% of South Sudan's urban population lived in slums, the highest percentage worldwide.

title: Lowest School Enrollment Rates
description: In 2015, South Sudan had the lowest net enrollment rate for secondary education at 5.5%, with female enrollment even lower at 4.5%.

title: Highest Poverty Rate
description: In 2016, 82.3% of South Sudan's population lived below the national poverty line, one of the highest rates globally.

title: Highest Prevalence of Severe Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, 63.2% of South Sudan's population experienced severe food insecurity, the highest prevalence in the world.

title: Highest Infant Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, South Sudan had the highest infant mortality rate, with 72.6 deaths per 1,000 live births.
